meanings.definition: The lower pair of wings on an insect or bird.
meanings.sent1: The butterfly's underwings were colorful and bright.
meanings.sent2: Birds use their underwings to soar through the sky.
meanings.sent3: The underwings of the dragonfly were like tiny stained glass windows.
meanings.sent4: The underwings of the airplane helped it stay balanced in flight.
meanings.sent5: The underwings of the eagle were a majestic sight as it glided overhead.

meanings.definition: The underside of a bird's wings.
meanings.sent1: The owl's underwings were soft and fluffy.
meanings.sent2: The underwings of the seagull were white and pristine.
meanings.sent3: The underwings of the pigeon were ticklish when touched.
meanings.sent4: The underwings of the hawk were a shadow against the sky.
meanings.sent5: The underwings of the crow were sleek and shiny in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: The lower surface of a bird's wings.
meanings.sent1: The sparrow's underwings were a pale brown color.
meanings.sent2: The underwings of the robin had a pattern of spots.
meanings.sent3: The underwings of the blue jay were tickled by the breeze.
meanings.sent4: The underwings of the swallow were like a flash of blue in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The underwings of the hummingbird shimmered in the sunlight.
